result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. Seay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**1 day credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

timeConds.notes: All stayed pending further order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. Seay

defendant.name: Seay, Joseph A.
defendant.address: 230 Mount Washington Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.
Renumbers Count 4 and 5 to Counts 1 and 2.

(Case called at 10:04 AM) Defendant Joseph A. Seay in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph A. Seay.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. State will file Information later today. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as party to a crime. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 18 months Probation with the following conditions: 45 days jail all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 1 day credit, if revoked.

9:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph A. Seay not in court, Barron County Jail did not connect to Zoom.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph A. Seay. 
New date given.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 9:46 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph A. Seay appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph A. Seay. 
Defense recently appointed- requests adjournment. 
Hearing: 08/18/2022 at 9:30 AM.

11:25am Court Commissioner Dan Smetana for Br. 3 Intake. Defendant Joseph Seay appeared in custody from the Eau Claire County jail with Attorney Sonya Anderson. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Bond is set. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office on 06/22/22 at 2pm
Hearing: 07/12/22 at 9:30am

Conditions:
No contact with co-defendant, Melissa Hazelton.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia. 
Report to CTC within 24 hours of being released from jail & comply with testing/programming.

citations.chargeDescr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
